Message.Title: So, The Appropriate Managment/Funding of Pensions Should Be @ the Top Of The Performance
Message.Msg: review when doling out salaries, options, and bonuses to the executives committee. Actually, it should take priority as it impacts 1,000's of lives. They JUST figured this out?

Message.Title: A must read articulao in today's Barrons
Message.Msg: The confusion between S, Clearwire, T-Mobile and DISH (add to the mix DIRECTO-TV, soon to join the party) is the best thing for T and VZ since it will delay and nullify any competitive pressures in the marketplace.

Reich, and his like-thinking communist friend Paul Krugman, are what ails a great capitalistic country like America. They bow to the European model of socialism that has failed miserably. Ponzi schemes don't work, confiscation of other peoples wealth doesn't work, and donkeys don't work.

Topic.Title: So, The Appropriate Managment/Funding of Pensions Should Be @ the Top Of The Performance

Message.Msg: Yes and no. They must be factored into the big picture since running a company is no different than a football game where the scrore board tells the most important outcome. Same in running a company where the final profit or loss is what is of outmost important end-result. Surely pensions must be factored in but not to the point of short changing the employees or for that matter the shareholders. Let it be known that it was the former CEO of then AT&T Bob Allen's famous saying that "people are our most important asset." IMO, he was being very dishonest when saying that since immediately thereafter he would turn around and fire tens of thousands of innocent working-class people while giving himself the most generous increases and bonuses he could get away with.

did 3X, 35.5, 34.45, 33.45, and will add as/if it goes lower. Had an order in 1 day this week under 33 and it went up so i closed it out. I don't have that many shares, we're talking 100 shares at a time and in an ira. I now :( believe in diversification and never margin :( again. T went to 20 and one time in the last decade and they didn't cut their div, I like 5% div, I am not greedy.

Topic.Title: AHQ we're being overrun by Saharian sand pirots...

Message.Msg: It just hit me! My dog sleeps about 20 hours a day. He has his food prepared for him. His meals are provided at no cost to him. He visits the Dr. once a year for his checkup, and again during the year, if any medical needs arise. For this he pays nothing, and nothing is required of him. He lives in a nice neighborhood in a house that is much larger than he needs, but he is not required to do any upkeep. If he makes a mess, someone else cleans it up. He has his choice of luxurious places to sleep. He receives these accommodations absolutely free. He is living like a king, and has absolutely no expenses whatsoever. All of his costs are picked up by others who earn a living. I was just thinking about all this, and suddenly it hit me like a brick .......... My dog is a Democrat!!!!

Topic.Title: AHQ we're being overrun by Saharian sand pirots...

Message.Msg: Your dog is a democrat and you are an idiot. What did you expect?

Topic.Title: AHQ we're being overrun by Saharian sand pirots...

Message.Msg: Sounds like he expected something even dumber than his dog to answer. And you obliged him. ROTFL

Topic.Title: So, The Appropriate Managment/Funding of Pensions Should Be @ the Top Of The Performance

Message.Msg: Factored in??? It's been nearly 5 years of sub-par growth in Pension Obligations due to financial calamity and it's been well-broadcasted to last perhaps a couple more years. Now they take action?

Message.Title: Underfund pensions but gift $4 Billion to T-Mobile
Message.Msg: The $4 B would have gone a long way to filling the pension gap. The elimination of senior management bonuses for at least 5 years would seem to be in order based on just these two examples of management incompetence.
